author: Hans van Dreven
text:
Find it difficult to report a seller without having to sign up to another provider.
The site allows sellers to leave advertised products on auction for extended periods of time even though the product is no longer available
Grailed seems to have very little control over seller's behaviour and in many instances take no responsibility for none shipment of sold products.
Because of this none compliment environment, a buyer can; 
1/ never be sure if the stock is actually available
2/ never be sure if the seller will ship the order after payment.

This has resulted in a period of approx 3 months covering approx eight purchases having to via PayPal request 2 refunds where Grailed offered no assistance and 1 refund which Grailed did provide.

The lack of compliance enforced by Grailed seems to have attracted abusers of the on-line trading, as an example;

In 9 years of trading with eBay,  I have only ever had to request 2 refunds for none shipment of purchase and in both cases, eBay provided the refund.

I wish to add that Grailed does not allow negative feedback on a seller to be viewed.
title: Find it difficult to report a seller…

text: Satisfaction depends significantly on the individual seller.  I've had very positive experiences with quality merchandise, and prompt responses from sellers. author: Bermondsey
text:
From the buyer’s perspective (and Grailed admitted) there’s little protection to ensure a seller doesn’t change his mind and decides to renege on a deal already done. 

I saw an item, where the seller has listed $25 shipping to Asia, seller and I corresponded and agreed a price, I paid using PayPal, deal was done. But after a few days the seller decided he did not want to ship anymore to outside US and unilaterally cancelled the deal, and simply refunded my purchase price. When I insisted he ships the item because a deal was made, he laughed and said I could not “force” him to sell to me. 

This is grossly disappointing. Grailed is a site for hard to get authentic and unique items - that is its entire value proposition. But Grailed does nothing to ensure that a seller honors a deal that has been struck and fully paid for. Just as buyers cannot change their minds, similarly should be expected of sellers - else don’t list the item with shipping to specific regions! 

Grailed customer service responded with a curt and officious email - “Unfortunately per our terms of service, sellers reserve the right to refund a transaction with or without reason at their own discretion.” 

This was a disappointing experience because the item was meant to be a special birthday gift for a loved one, now that has discouraged me from buying anymore from Grailed.
title: Poor buyer protection to get seller to honor deals
